data.title: 7 Ages of Rock
data.meta_description: Ozzy Osboune (born John Michael Osbourne, 3rd December 3, 1948 in Aston, Birmingham, England) is a singer - lead vocalist of the pioneering heavy metal band Black Sabbath - popular solo artist, and former star of the popular reality show The Osbournes.

Ozzy Osbourne

Biography

Ozzy Osbourne (born John Michael Osbourne, 3rd December 3, 1948 in Aston, Birmingham, England) is a singer - lead vocalist of the pioneering heavy metal band Black Sabbath - popular solo artist, and former star of the popular reality show The Osbournes.

As a solo artist, Osbourne has sold over 27 million albums in the US. Two albums, Blizzard of Ozz (1980) and No More Tears (1991), are certified quadruple platinum, for sales of over 4 million copies in the US...

Read more at Wikipedia

Wikipedia

This entry is from Wikipedia, the user-contributed encyclopedia. It may not have been reviewed by professional editors (more info) and is licensed under the GNU Free Documentation License. Any changes made to the Wikipedia article will not be immediately reflected here.

Artist Timeline

1979 Sacked from Black Sabbath after a decade as their vocalist

1980 Forms the Ozzy Osbourne Band (known intitally as The Blizzard of Ozz)

1982 Star guitarist Randy Rhoads dies in a plane crash

1982 Infamous bat biting incident

1986 Accused of writing lyrics that influenced the suicide of a teenage boy

1993 Announces his retirement, which is followed by the 'Retirement Sucks' Tour

1996 The first Ozzfest is held, to date it has grossed over $100m

2002 The first series of 'The Osbournes' becomes the most watched ever on MTV

2003 Seriously injures himself in a motor accident

2003 While in hospital has his first number one, a duet with daughter Kelly

2005 Moons the crowd while being inducted into the UK Music Hall Of Fame

Key Releases

Blizzard of Ozz

Ozzy's debut shifted over 4m units in the US despite the lack of a big hit single.

Review on BBC Music

Diary Of A Madman

The last album to feature the talents of Randy Rhoads
